                                                                                                                                                                                                            Biology

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                            Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                              One of: (BIOL 2210, 2315, 2316, 2325, 210, 215, 216, 225) OR (ENVS 2224 or 215)

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                              1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                              2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                              3-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                              4-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                              5-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                              6-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                              Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                              Highlights biological principles from evolution and ecology applicable to development and sustainability of agriculture. Addresses productivity limits in agro-ecosystems and challenges facing modern agriculture. Discusses; trophic structure of agricultural systems, plant performance in agricultural environments, features of domesticated species, coevolution of weeds and crops, pesticide development and pesticide resistance, impacts of land use change, transgenics, and organic farming.

                                                                                                                                                                                                            Molecular Evolution

                                                                                                                                                                                                                One of: (BIOL 2112, 2118, 2124, 2175, 2316, 212, 216-218, or 224) OR CHEM 231

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                BIOL 317 From Fall 1999 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                3-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                4-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                5-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                6-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                Examines the dynamics of evolutionary change at the molecular level. Topics include neutral theory of molecular evolution, rates and patterns of change in nucleotide sequences and proteins, molecular phylogenetics, and genome evolution. Students read and discuss papers from the scientific literature, and complete independent projects in the laboratory.

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                              • CapacityActualRemainingPending Requests

                                                                                                                                                                                                              BIOL 3333
                                                                                                                                                                                                              20076
                                                                                                                                                                                                              Advanced Cell and Molecular Biology
                                                                                                                                                                                                              aNatural Science & Math                                                                                                                                                                                                               		T 6:30-9:25 PM Bruce Kohorn TBA

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  One of: (BIOL 2124 or 224) OR CHEM 231

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  BIOL 333 From Fall 2001 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  3-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  4-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  5-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  6-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  An exploration of the multiple ways cells have evolved to transmit signals from their external environment to cause alterations in cell architecture, physiology, and gene expression. Examples are drawn from both single-cell and multi-cellular organisms, including bacteria, fungi, algae, land plants, insects, worms, and mammals. Emphasis is on the primary literature, with directed discussion and some background introductory remarks for each class.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                CHEM 1059
                                                                                                                                                                                                                20077
                                                                                                                                                                                                                FULL
                                                                                                                                                                                                                Chemistry of Consumer Goods
                                                                                                                                                                                                                INSInquiry in Natural Sci
                                                                                                                                                                                                                aNatural Science & Math                                                                                                                                                                                                                 		TR 10:00-11:25 AM Yi Jin Gorske TBA
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Associated Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Spring 2014

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Credits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  1.0

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Chemistry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    CHEM 059 From Fall 2012 Through Fall 2012

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Natural and synthetic “chemicals” make up virtually everything we purchase and consume from breakfast cereals to soaps, shampoo bottles, and over-the-counter medications. Examines the chemical components of food, drugs, soaps, plastics, and other consumer goods we encounter daily. Explores scientific resources that can be used to obtain information on product components, safety, and regulations. Also considers topics related to some of the current safety concerns raised by chemicals found in common household items through case studies and research projects. Assumes no background in science. Not open to students who have credit for a chemistry course numbered 1100 (100) or higher.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Chemistry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      You may not register for this class if you have completed any of the following with passing grades —

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      CHEM 1109

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      CHEM 1101 or 101

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      CHEM 102 From Spring 1987 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The second course in a two-semester introductory college chemistry sequence. Introduction to chemical bonding and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1109 (109) may not take Chemistry 1102 (102) for credit.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Review Session: Tue 6:30-8:25 pm

                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The second course in a two-semester introductory college chemistry sequence. Introduction to chemical bonding and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1109 (109) may not take Chemistry 1102 (102) for credit.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The second course in a two-semester introductory college chemistry sequence. Introduction to chemical bonding and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1109 (109) may not take Chemistry 1102 (102) for credit.

Introduction to chemical bonding and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1109 (109) may not take Chemistry 1102 (102) for credit.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    One of: (BIOL 1100-3999 or 100-399) OR (CHEM 1100-3999 or 100-399) OR (EOS 1100-3999 or 100-399) OR (PHYS 1100-3999 or 100-399) OR GEOL 100-399

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    CHEM 105 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    BIOL 158 From Spring 2005 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    CHEM 180 From Spring 2005 Through Spring 2006

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    ENVS 201 From Spring 2005 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    3-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    4-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    5-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    6-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Functioning of the earth system is defined by the complex and fascinating interaction of processes within and between four principal spheres: land, air, water, and life. Leverages key principles of environmental chemistry and ecology to unravel the intricate connectedness of natural phenomena and ecosystem function. Fundamental biological and chemical concepts are used to understand the science behind the environmental dilemmas facing societies as a consequence of human activities. Laboratory sessions consist of local field trips, laboratory experiments, group research, case study exercises, and discussions of current and classic scientific literature.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Functioning of the earth system is defined by the complex and fascinating interaction of processes within and between four principal spheres: land, air, water, and life. Leverages key principles of environmental chemistry and ecology to unravel the intricate connectedness of natural phenomena and ecosystem function. Fundamental biological and chemical concepts are used to understand the science behind the environmental dilemmas facing societies as a consequence of human activities. Laboratory sessions consist of local field trips, laboratory experiments, group research, case study exercises, and discussions of current and classic scientific literature.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        4-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        6-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Functioning of the earth system is defined by the complex and fascinating interaction of processes within and between four principal spheres: land, air, water, and life. Leverages key principles of environmental chemistry and ecology to unravel the intricate connectedness of natural phenomena and ecosystem function. Fundamental biological and chemical concepts are used to understand the science behind the environmental dilemmas facing societies as a consequence of human activities. Laboratory sessions consist of local field trips, laboratory experiments, group research, case study exercises, and discussions of current and classic scientific literature.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • CapacityActualRemainingPending Requests
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        151050
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Bowdoin Bookstore

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Functioning of the earth system is defined by the complex and fascinating interaction of processes within and between four principal spheres: land, air, water, and life. Leverages key principles of environmental chemistry and ecology to unravel the intricate connectedness of natural phenomena and ecosystem function. Fundamental biological and chemical concepts are used to understand the science behind the environmental dilemmas facing societies as a consequence of human activities. Laboratory sessions consist of local field trips, laboratory experiments, group research, case study exercises, and discussions of current and classic scientific literature.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            You may not register for this class if you have completed any of the following with passing grades —

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            CHEM 1102

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            CHEM 109 From Fall 1995 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            A one-semester introductory chemistry course. Introduction to models of atomic structure, chemical bonding, and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1102 (102) may not take Chemistry 1109 (109) for credit. To ensure proper placement, students must take the chemistry placement examination and must be recommended for placement in Chemistry 1109 (109).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        A one-semester introductory chemistry course. Introduction to models of atomic structure, chemical bonding, and intermolecular forces; characterization of chemical systems at equilibrium and spontaneous processes; the rates of chemical reactions; and special topics. Lectures, review sessions, and four hours of laboratory work per week. Students who have taken Chemistry 1102 (102) may not take Chemistry 1109 (109) for credit. To ensure proper placement, students must take the chemistry placement examination and must be recommended for placement in Chemistry 1109 (109).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Bowdoin Bookstore
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Instructions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      CHEM 2050
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      20092
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Environmental Chemistry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      		 ENVS 2255
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      EOS 2325
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      INSInquiry in Natural Sci
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      aNatural Science & Math                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       		MWF 11:30-12:25 PM David Griffith TBA
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Associated Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Spring 2014

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Credits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        1.0

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Chemistry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          One of: (CHEM 1102, 1109, 2000-2969, 102, 109, or 200-289) OR (Placement at CHEM 2000 level)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          GEOL 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          CHEM 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          EOS 206 From Spring 2013 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          ENVS 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          ENVS 211 From Spring 2013 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Weekly Review Session

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • CapacityActualRemainingPending Requests
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          355300
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Bowdoin Bookstore
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Instructions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        CHEM 2050
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        20093
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        L1
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Environmental Chemistry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        		 ENVS 2255
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        EOS 2325
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        INSInquiry in Natural Sci
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        aNatural Science & Math                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         		M 1:00-3:55 PM Martha Black TBA
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Associated Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Spring 2014

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Credits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          0.0

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Chemistry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            One of: (CHEM 1102, 1109, 2000-2969, 102, 109, or 200-289) OR (Placement at CHEM 2000 level)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            GEOL 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            CHEM 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            EOS 206 From Spring 2013 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            ENVS 205 From Spring 2007 Through Spring 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            ENVS 211 From Spring 2013 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.
