                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Theater and Dance

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    One of: (THTR 1100-1999 or 100-199) OR (DANC 1100-1999 or 100-199) OR (MUS 1100-1999 or 100-199) OR (VART 1100-1999 or 100-199)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    This is a course for actors, gymnasts, writers, dancers, visual artists, media designers, composers, singers, and musicians. Working from a short story by Kurt Vonnegut (“Harrison Bergeron”), students from across disciplines will collaboratively create an original theatre work combining circus acrobatics, dramatic text, physical theatre, dance, clowning, original music, singing, instrumental ensemble, visual composition, and technological design. The project will build upon the talents and skills of those who enroll, and offer participants opportunities to design, compose, arrange, choreograph, write, and/or perform. The course will culminate in a fully staged production in Wish Theatre in spring.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Intermediate/advanced repertory students are required to take Dance 3211 (311) concurrently. A continuation of the principles and practices introduced in Dance 2212 (212). May be repeated for credit. Grading is Credit/D/Fail. One-half credit.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          1-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          2-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          3-juniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          4-seniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          An introduction to aspects of geology and hydrology that affect the environment and land use. Topics include lakes, watersheds and surface-water quality, groundwater contamination, coastal erosion, and landslides. Weekly labs and fieldwork examine local environmental problems affecting Maine’s rivers, lakes, and coast. Students complete a community-based research project on Maine water quality. Formerly Geology 100 (same as Environmental Studies 100).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            An introduction to aspects of geology and hydrology that affect the environment and land use. Topics include lakes, watersheds and surface-water quality, groundwater contamination, coastal erosion, and landslides. Weekly labs and fieldwork examine local environmental problems affecting Maine’s rivers, lakes, and coast. Students complete a community-based research project on Maine water quality. Formerly Geology 100 (same as Environmental Studies 100).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              An introduction to aspects of geology and hydrology that affect the environment and land use. Topics include lakes, watersheds and surface-water quality, groundwater contamination, coastal erosion, and landslides. Weekly labs and fieldwork examine local environmental problems affecting Maine’s rivers, lakes, and coast. Students complete a community-based research project on Maine water quality. Formerly Geology 100 (same as Environmental Studies 100).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Associated Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Spring 2014

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Credits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              1.0

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Earth and Oceanographic Sci

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ENVS 102 From Spring 2011 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                EOS 102 From Spring 2011 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                GEOL 102 From Fall 2009 Through Fall 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                1-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                2-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                3-juniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                4-seniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                The fundamentals of geological, physical, chemical, and biological oceanography: tectonic evolution of the ocean basins; sedimentation as a record of ocean history; global ocean circulation, waves, and tides; chemical cycles; ocean ecosystems and productivity; and the oceans’ role in climate change. Weekly labs and fieldwork demonstrate these principles in the setting of Casco Bay and the Gulf of Maine. Students complete a field-based research project on coastal oceanography.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  1-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  2-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  3-juniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  4-seniors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The fundamentals of geological, physical, chemical, and biological oceanography: tectonic evolution of the ocean basins; sedimentation as a record of ocean history; global ocean circulation, waves, and tides; chemical cycles; ocean ecosystems and productivity; and the oceans’ role in climate change. Weekly labs and fieldwork demonstrate these principles in the setting of Casco Bay and the Gulf of Maine. Students complete a field-based research project on coastal oceanography.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    The fundamentals of geological, physical, chemical, and biological oceanography: tectonic evolution of the ocean basins; sedimentation as a record of ocean history; global ocean circulation, waves, and tides; chemical cycles; ocean ecosystems and productivity; and the oceans’ role in climate change. Weekly labs and fieldwork demonstrate these principles in the setting of Casco Bay and the Gulf of Maine. Students complete a field-based research project on coastal oceanography.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The fundamentals of geological, physical, chemical, and biological oceanography: tectonic evolution of the ocean basins; sedimentation as a record of ocean history; global ocean circulation, waves, and tides; chemical cycles; ocean ecosystems and productivity; and the oceans’ role in climate change. Weekly labs and fieldwork demonstrate these principles in the setting of Casco Bay and the Gulf of Maine. Students complete a field-based research project on coastal oceanography.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Explores the historical, current, and future demands of society on the natural resources of the earth and the ocean. Discusses the formation and extraction of salt, gold, diamonds, rare earth elements, coal, oil, natural gas, and renewable energies (e.g., tidal, geothermal, solar, wind). Examines how policies for these resources are written and revised to reflect changing societal values. Students complete a research project that explores the intersection of natural resources and society.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Although only ~40 years old, the theory of plate tectonics forever changed the way we view our Earth, from static to dynamic. Plate tectonics provides a global framework to understand such varied phenomena as earthquakes, volcanoes, ocean basins and mountain systems both on continents (e.g. the Himalaya, the Andes) and beneath the seas (e.g. the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, the East Pacific Rise). In-depth analysis of plate boundaries, the driving forces of plate tectonics, global plate reconstructions and the predictive

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Although only ~40 years old, the theory of plate tectonics forever changed the way we view our Earth, from static to dynamic. Plate tectonics provides a global framework to understand such varied phenomena as earthquakes, volcanoes, ocean basins and mountain systems both on continents (e.g. the Himalaya, the Andes) and beneath the seas (e.g. the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, the East Pacific Rise). In-depth analysis of plate boundaries, the driving forces of plate tectonics, global plate reconstructions and the predictive

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Weekly Review Session

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • CapacityActualRemainingPending Requests

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Focuses on two key processes that influence human and wildlife exposure to potentially harmful substances—chemical speciation and transformation. Equilibrium principles as applied to acid-base, complexation, precipitation, and dissolution reactions are used to explore organic and inorganic compound speciation in natural and polluted waters; quantitative approaches are emphasized. Weekly laboratory sections are concerned with the detection and quantification of organic and inorganic compounds in air, water, and soils/sediments.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Glaciers and Ice Ages
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                aNatural Science & Math                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 		TR 8:30-9:55 AM Peter Lea TBA

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Earth and Oceanographic Sci

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    One of: (EOS 1000-3999 or 010-399) OR (ENVS 1102, 1104, 1515, 102, 104, 105)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    GEOL 272 From Fall 2004 Through Fall 2009

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    During recent ice ages, glaciers covered a third of the world’s land area and had profound impacts on earth’s landscapes and climates. Uses lectures, labs, field trips, and reading of the primary literature to examine the controls of current and former glacier distribution and movement, landforms and landscapes of glacial and meltwater systems, and the interaction of glaciers and the earth’s climate system.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      During recent ice ages, glaciers covered a third of the world’s land area and had profound impacts on earth’s landscapes and climates. Uses lectures, labs, field trips, and reading of the primary literature to examine the controls of current and former glacier distribution and movement, landforms and landscapes of glacial and meltwater systems, and the interaction of glaciers and the earth’s climate system.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        During recent ice ages, glaciers covered a third of the world’s land area and had profound impacts on earth’s landscapes and climates. Uses lectures, labs, field trips, and reading of the primary literature to examine the controls of current and former glacier distribution and movement, landforms and landscapes of glacial and meltwater systems, and the interaction of glaciers and the earth’s climate system.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Earth and Oceanographic Sci

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          One of: (EOS 1105-1515, 2005, 101-105, or 200) OR (ENVS 2221 or 200) OR GEOL 101

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          EOS 250 From Fall 2011 Through Fall 2011

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          GEOL 250 From Spring 1993 Through Fall 2008

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Structure of ocean basins, continental margins and marine sediments. The influence of plate tectonics on major events in oceanographic and climatic evolution. Sediment classification and distribution in the modern and ancient ocean. The geological and geophysical bases of the plate-tectonic model.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Paleo Perspectives on Ocean Acidification
