                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Earth and Oceanographic Sci

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Two courses: [(EOS 1100-1999 or 100-199) or (ENVS 1102, 1104, 1515, 102, 104, or 105)] AND [(EOS 2005 or 200) or (ENVS 2221 or 200)]

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            1-junior majors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            2-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            3-senior majors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            4-senior minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            5-junior minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            6-senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            7-junior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            8-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Recent trends of carbon emissions and subsequent acidification of the surface ocean raises concerns over the potential impacts on marine ecosystems. Similar events from the geologic record may provide insight on current and future ocean conditions. Earth history (past ~300 million years) of ocean acidification and rapid carbon perturbations. Evidence and indications of past intervals of ocean acidification and the associated biotic responses. Laboratory component focuses on the fundamentals of carbonate chemistry and evidence from paleoceanographic sediment archives.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Recent trends of carbon emissions and subsequent acidification of the surface ocean raises concerns over the potential impacts on marine ecosystems. Similar events from the geologic record may provide insight on current and future ocean conditions. Earth history (past ~300 million years) of ocean acidification and rapid carbon perturbations. Evidence and indications of past intervals of ocean acidification and the associated biotic responses. Laboratory component focuses on the fundamentals of carbonate chemistry and evidence from paleoceanographic sediment archives.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Separate Lab(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Originating Department

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Earth and Oceanographic Sci

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Must be declared in one of the following Majors —

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Earth and Oceanographic Sci, Envir St-Earth and Ocean Sci, Environmental Studies

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                (EOS 2005 or 200) OR (ENVS 2221 or 200)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                EOS 302 From Spring 2012 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                GEOL 302 From Spring 2010 Through Spring 2010

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ENVS 302 From Spring 2010 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                BIOL 302 From Spring 2010 Through Spring 2012

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                The modern world is experiencing rapid climate warming and some parts extreme drought, which will have dramatic impacts on ecosystems and human societies. How do contemporary warming and aridity compare to past changes in climate over the last billion years? Are modern changes human-caused or part of the natural variability in the climate system? What effects did past changes have on global ecosystems and human societies? Students use environmental records from rocks, soils, ocean cores, ice cores, lake cores, fossil plants, and tree rings to assemble proxies of past changes in climate, atmospheric CO2, and disturbance to examine several issues: long-term carbon cycling and climate, major extinction events, the rise of C4 photosynthesis and the evolution of grazing mammals, orbital forcing and glacial cycles, glacial refugia and post-glacial species migrations, climate change and the rise and collapse of human civilizations, climate/overkill hypothesis of Pleistocene megafauna, climate variability, drought cycles, climate change impacts on disturbances (fire and hurricanes), and determining natural variability vs. human-caused climate change

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Research in Mineral Science

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  No

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Minerals are the Earth’s building blocks and an important human resource. The study of minerals provides information on processes that occur within the Earth’s core, mantle, crust, and at its surface. At the surface, minerals interact with the hydrosphere, atmosphere and biosphere, and are essential to understanding environmental issues. Minerals and mineral processes examined using hand-specimens, crystal structures, chemistry, and microscopy. Class projects emphasize mineral-based research.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Minerals are the Earth’s building blocks and an important human resource. The study of minerals provides information on processes that occur within the Earth’s core, mantle, crust, and at its surface. At the surface, minerals interact with the hydrosphere, atmosphere and biosphere, and are essential to understanding environmental issues. Minerals and mineral processes examined using hand-specimens, crystal structures, chemistry, and microscopy. Class projects emphasize mineral-based research.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      An introduction to economic analysis and institutions, with special emphasis on the allocation of resources through markets. The theory of demand, supply, cost, and market structure is developed and then applied to problems in antitrust policy, environmental quality, energy, education, health, the role of the corporation in society, income distribution, and poverty. Students desiring a comprehensive introduction to economic reasoning should take both Economics 1101 101 and 1102 102.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Economics

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            (ECON 1101 or 101) OR (Earned ECON 1101 with placement)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            ECON 102 From Fall 1986 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            All equally

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            An introduction to economic analysis and institutions, with special emphasis on determinants of the level of national income, prices, and employment. Current problems of inflation and unemployment are explored with the aid of such analysis, and alternative views of the effectiveness of fiscal, monetary, and other governmental policies are analyzed. Attention is given to the sources and consequences of economic growth and to the nature and significance of international linkages through goods and capital markets.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              An introduction to economic analysis and institutions, with special emphasis on determinants of the level of national income, prices, and employment. Current problems of inflation and unemployment are explored with the aid of such analysis, and alternative views of the effectiveness of fiscal, monetary, and other governmental policies are analyzed. Attention is given to the sources and consequences of economic growth and to the nature and significance of international linkages through goods and capital markets.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                An introduction to economic analysis and institutions, with special emphasis on determinants of the level of national income, prices, and employment. Current problems of inflation and unemployment are explored with the aid of such analysis, and alternative views of the effectiveness of fiscal, monetary, and other governmental policies are analyzed. Attention is given to the sources and consequences of economic growth and to the nature and significance of international linkages through goods and capital markets.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  An introduction to economic analysis and institutions, with special emphasis on determinants of the level of national income, prices, and employment. Current problems of inflation and unemployment are explored with the aid of such analysis, and alternative views of the effectiveness of fiscal, monetary, and other governmental policies are analyzed. Attention is given to the sources and consequences of economic growth and to the nature and significance of international linkages through goods and capital markets.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Natural Resource Economics and Policy
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                		 ENVS 2303
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                MCSRMath Comp Stat Reasoning
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                bSocial & Behavioral Sciences                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 		MW 11:30-12:55 PM Guillermo Herrera TBA
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Associated Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Spring 2014

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Credits

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  1.0

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    ECON 228 From Spring 2002 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    1-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    2-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    3-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    4-non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    A study of the economic issues surrounding the existence and use of renewable natural resources (e.g., forestry/land use, fisheries, water, ecosystems, and the effectiveness of antibiotics) and exhaustible resources (such as minerals, fossil fuels, and old growth forest). A basic framework is first developed for determining economically efficient use of resources over time, then extended to consider objectives other than efficiency, as well as the distinguishing biological, ecological, physical, political, and social attributes of each resource. Uncertainty, common property, and various regulatory instruments are discussed, as well as alternatives to government intervention and/or privatization.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The Economics of Information

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Economics

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Other Class Attributes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Permission Required

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Major/Minor Restriction

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Standing Restrictions

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Exclusion

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Prerequisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      (ECON 1101 or 101) OR (Earned ECON 1101 with placement)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      4-non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Many standard economic models assume perfect and complete information. The economics of information explores how economic phenomena can be better understood by relaxing this assumption. Topics include decision-making under risk, adverse selection, moral hazard, information processing/belief updating, communication, the efficient market hypothesis, firm competition and reputation, advertising and media. The course will develop and use selected tools from probability theory and game theory.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Class Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Class Eligibility Rules

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Three courses: [(ECON 1101 or 101) or (Earned ECON 1101 with placement)] AND [(ECON 1102 or 102) or (Earned ECON 1102 with placement)] AND [(MATH 1600-3999 or 161-399 or (Placement in MATH 1700) or (Placement in MATH 1750) or (Placement in MATH 1800) or (Placement in MATH 2000 level)]

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Co-requisite

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Equivalent Course(s)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ECON 255 From Fall 1986 Through Spring 2013

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Preferences for Spring Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        1-senior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        2-junior majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        3-sophomores

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        4-first years

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5 junior/senior non-majors/minors

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Preferences for Fall Term

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Registration Priority for Previously Shut Out

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Yes

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Course Description

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        An intermediate-level study of contemporary microeconomic theory. Analysis of the theory of resource allocation and distribution, with major emphasis on systems of markets and prices as a social mechanism for making resource allocation decisions. Topics include the theory of individual choice and demand, the theory of the firm, market equilibrium under competition and monopoly, general equilibrium theory, and welfare economics.
